definition: quick witted in an emergency/able to react resourcefully
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Then suddenly, an idea came into her racing, terrified brain.
sentences.chinese: 但馬上急中生智，一個主意跳出了她快速轉動的腦海。

sentences.english: With great presence of mind a fireman pulled the driver away from the burning cab.
sentences.chinese: 一位消防員急中生智，將司機從燃燒的車裏拉出來。

sentences.english: The original gowardesh used his quick wits to use grenades fry an export.
sentences.chinese: 原來狗娃急中生智用手榴彈炸個出口。

sentences.english: The fox was very quick-witted and pretended to be sacrosanct .
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的狐狸急中生智，裝出一副神聖不可侵犯的樣子。

definition: a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
inspiration in a moment of desperation (idiom)/also written 情急之下
in a great rush/in a flurry
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
